messages: f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:14): is there an easy, supported, way of doing document ready event without jquery etc.?
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:14): like, how google adsense and others do it
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:15): f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a: a safe bet would be window.onload
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:15): it comes just after ready
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:16): depending on the site window.onload could come much later than the DOM ready event
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:16): but if you want to execute before images are loaded, then try DOMContentLoaded
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:17): f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a: you could always just look at the jquery source and abstract out their logic
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:17): 7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8: DOMContentLoad is supported but Mozilla and Webkit
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:17): I don't care about IE... bwahahahahahaa
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:17): this is the power of... HTML5!
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:17): ehh dunno, gonna have to ask google about that
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:17): will do

7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:18): f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a: you should at least support ie, html5 doesn't mean that we leave ie users to hang out to dry (but I do understand the desire to do so...)
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:18): 7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8: I am doing mobile browsers
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:19): oh, then mobile ie shouldn't give a horrible time
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:19): what's the WP7 marketshare look like these days?
0fe8692be7a494c6561f745b9f3b0d17 (01:20): *shrugs* i ignore microsoft news
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:20): 7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8: I don't care about Windows phone users
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:20): I'll just detect them by user agent and give them a Bill Gates face with caption "Are you happy NOW???"
c3ea1206a9b3c12e254531c9f2fc4342 (01:20): windows phone 7 is another piece of crap from microsoft mobile
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:21): c3ea1206a9b3c12e254531c9f2fc4342: idk, I've heard some nice things from friends who have it
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:21): I found the mobile browser to not be as bad as it could be
c3ea1206a9b3c12e254531c9f2fc4342 (01:21): 1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 they still use ie7
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:21): Not alot unexpected behaviors
c3ea1206a9b3c12e254531c9f2fc4342 (01:22): that means no geolocation support
c3ea1206a9b3c12e254531c9f2fc4342 (01:22): and phones without geolocation support in browser are sooo 2009
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:23): well yeah the choice of IE on it was expected but unfortunate
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:23): I meant as a whole with the device
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:23): and reports show that it's at around 3-5% marketshare right now
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:23): 1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21: I have one to test with, and even tough its not very pretty is highly usable
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:23): I found myself browsing on it just because it was faster
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:24): (when compared to my android phone)
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:24): not in browsing speed, but the ui overal seems more fluid. easy to use.
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:24): 7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8: which android phone you have?
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:24): 7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8: yeah, it's replacing the crackberries from a few of my friends
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:24): maybe its because it has no graphics to lag it down
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:25): 1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21: yes, I would take a HD7 over any crackberry
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:26): f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a: using html5boilerplate I have very few issues developing for the windows phone
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:26): hmm, I really hope the 3.0 sdk google put out is far behind trunk, if it's not I can't see them fixing the major issues people are seeing in just 3 weeks
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:27): 1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21: i'm a little worried on how this android separations is going to affect the os as a whole
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:27): I hope, I can have software updates on my nexus up to the latest version
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:28): I say this because 3 (honeycomb) requires dual cores
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:28): (so i've read somewhere)
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:28): it has been busted by google
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:28): I expect nexus one go to up android 2.4 at least
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:28): yeah I thought the dual core thing was just for the tablet version
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:29): 1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21: I want to see what happens with these 2 brances, does this mean that android for phones ends at 3.0
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:29): or will they maintain different codebases for each type of device
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:30): lets not forget that google tv is also android based
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:30): thats 3 branches of the os already
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:30): 2.4 is just a rumor
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:30): the 3.0 emulator runs on phone screen sizes
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:31): 1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21: I thought that 3 had a completly revised ui
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:31): is it still workable on a phone?
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:32): there are pics up on xda of the phone emulator running 3.0
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:32): I should google for those, take a look
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:33): from what I gather, 3.0 is the next version for both, officially supports tablets, and adds a lot more to the UI when it's running on a tablet
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:33): they've never explicitly said 3.0 is tablets-only
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:33): at least not that I've come across

1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:34): "In an Engadget interview after CES, the UX guy who recently joined Android (from HP Palm) said that 3.1 will bring Android cell and Android tablet back into 1 version of the OS. Much like an app can have multiple "styles" for different resolutions, the OS will be fully capable of scaling to any realistic screen size."
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:34): so Ice Cream is 3.1
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:34): I think that clears it up
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:36): I've been holding off for a tablet, I want a android one :-) there is no joy in coding objective-c, I'll take java instead
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:37): neither java or objective-c are fun
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:37): I prefer PhoneGap
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:37): 7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8: but I have found monotouch and monodroid wonderful
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:38): for everything other than high-performance apps (like games), I see no reason to hand-code my mobile stuff
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:38): write once in HTML/CSS/JS, deploy to all mobile platforms
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:38): f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a: 1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 phone gap is killer, but sometimes I need to use method from the java core
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:38): 1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21: I love phonegap it works killer
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:39): 7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8: yeah in that case I'd drop down to native and submit a patch to the phonegap guys :)
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:39): but like you said, sometimes you needd a more native approach
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:39): 1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21: good point, I didn't know I could submit patches to them
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:39): 7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8: I have been using Phonegap. It is a proper tool for some tasks, but not all of them.
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:39): building native UI with right tools is much more pleasurable

7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:40): example, I coded this service that runs on my phone, and once connected to my home wireless, it will send a signal to my other computes, to wake the screens up, stop torrents. when I leave the home network, the screens go off, and torrents resume
7a205621b91e4878465075e964d2b1e8 (01:40): could not do that with phonegap unfortunatly
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:40): and the fact that you can insert breakpoints to your application and you can actually debug it
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:41): unlike, when webkit just simply dies under your app
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:45): does anyone have example how to invoke google adsense from pure javascript code?
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:47): I hope I don't need to call document.write
401ce21aa9b8a89d7d5616eda60cfe33 (01:49): I am not sure if I understand your question
401ce21aa9b8a89d7d5616eda60cfe33 (01:50): Isn't the code already javascript?
401ce21aa9b8a89d7d5616eda60cfe33 (01:51): As far as I understand you set some params using google_insertvariablehere and then call the show_ads.js from the Google CDN
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:53): but the default code is somehow depending on document.write
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:53): I'd want to have full async version
401ce21aa9b8a89d7d5616eda60cfe33 (01:53): So you want to take Google's code from the CDN and hardcode it into your page?
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:54): can we start some kind of movement to get developers to stop saying  in their documentation to add script tags in the head pointing to their js file
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:54): it's just encouraging bad behavior everywhere I look
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:55): 401ce21aa9b8a89d7d5616eda60cfe33: I want to dynamically include Google's code from CDN
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:55): and I want to control with Javascript whether the code comes there or not
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:55): f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a: http://webmasters.stackexchange.com/questions/2506/is-it-possible-to-use-asynchronous-google-adsense-i-e-non-blocking
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:55): I think this is exactly what I was looking for
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (01:56): I really hope the name choice of "webmasters" is a joke
401ce21aa9b8a89d7d5616eda60cfe33 (01:57): Moo- I think that what you are trying to do is prohibited
401ce21aa9b8a89d7d5616eda60cfe33 (01:57): I would check on the google adsense forums
401ce21aa9b8a89d7d5616eda60cfe33 (01:58): You are basically messing with Google's ability to target the ads to your content by doing so.
401ce21aa9b8a89d7d5616eda60cfe33 (01:58): Thus destroying their value proposition to the advertisers
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (01:59): makes sense
401ce21aa9b8a89d7d5616eda60cfe33 (01:59): I just want to make sure you get paid at the end of the month :)
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (02:00): does this food delivery site really allow individual restaurants to put auto-playing audio on their menu page
401ce21aa9b8a89d7d5616eda60cfe33 (02:04): Is anybody working on an earth shattering project that needs some help?
401ce21aa9b8a89d7d5616eda60cfe33 (02:04): I am frustrated. All my colleagues and friends are boring and don't want to work on projects in their free time.
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (02:04): 401ce21aa9b8a89d7d5616eda60cfe33: I will in the upcoming weeks
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (02:05): 401ce21aa9b8a89d7d5616eda60cfe33: it is not forbidden in TOS or Policy
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (02:05): I guess they are ok as long as AdSense bot can crawl the page
401ce21aa9b8a89d7d5616eda60cfe33 (02:05): Moo: Well then knock yourself out :)
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (02:05): f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a: I'd still ask on the adsense site anyway
1ef17f7652e4f736bfc0a5f707a78e21 (02:05): just to be sure
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (02:06): I have found it utterly useless try to ask anything from Google
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (02:13): the ad code is contained in anoymous function
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (02:13): I am not sure if this is invoked if I create <script> dynamically
f14de8990c8b25022fed1c699ffa487a (02:13): or does document.write fail
